scenario:
Amazon stock climbed 1,300% over the last decade and 45% in the last year, with a long-term opportunity in a global e-commerce market valued at $4.1 trillion. The company has solid positions in advertising and cloud computing, with $53 billion in ad service revenue and 19% year-over-year growth in Amazon Web Services revenue. Amazon's trailing free cash flow grew 123% year over year to $47 billion.

Alphabet, parent company of Google, has 2 billion users across its products, including Gmail, Google Search, and Google Maps, generating billions in advertising revenue. The company's free cash flow totaled $55 billion over the last year on $339 billion of revenue, with a long-term growth prospects fueled by its Gemini AI model. Alphabet's cloud business, Google Cloud, grew 35% year over year, with operating profit improving to $1.9 billion in Q3.

Berkshire Hathaway, led by Warren Buffett, is financially stronger than any other business, with $37 billion in operating earnings in 2023 and a $271 billion equity portfolio. Buffett's knack for value investing has generated tremendous wealth for shareholders, with a 20% annualized return from 1965 through 2023. Berkshire will still be a solid investment after Buffett, with Greg Abel, who oversees non-insurance operations, ready to take over as CEO. Berkshire's equity portfolio and cash reserves provide ample resources for investment opportunities.
